intro: Lavandula spica subsp. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf lavender, is a subspecies native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its wide, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its aromatic foliage and flowers are used in perfumery, herbal medicine, and ornamental gardening.
